executive_summary: Revenue has been volatile due to fluctuating commodity prices and changes in downstream industrial activity. Despite economic activity halting amid the COVID-19 pandemic, the industry has experienced revenue growth because of sustained product demand, especially from the healthcare sector. Also, a boost in demand for industrial gases to meet rising energy needs has assisted in industry growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Boost in demand for industrial gases to meet rising energy needs has assisted in industry growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry-wide revenue has been increasing at a CAGR of 8.8% over the past five years, reaching an estimated $16.2 billion in 2023, despite a projected 3.5% slump in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The industry is highly concentrated and globalized, dominated by only a handful of global industrial gas manufacturers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Also, the industry's capital-intensive nature makes it rather difficult for new companies to enter successfully. The largest manufacturer has engaged in strategic acquisitions over the past five years boosting market share concentration.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising wages, high utility costs, and recent business disruptions have therefore contributed to falling industry profit
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is expected to account for 7.5% of revenue in 2023, down from 7.7% in 2018.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Changes in Downstream Industry Output Have a Direct Effect on Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising consumer spending will support manufacturing consumer goods, which often require industrial gases. Still, revenue will likely drop as foreign manufacturers ramp up production.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: SLOW REVENUE GROWTH IS EXPECTED TO LIMIT THE INDUSTRY'S ABILITY TO EXPAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Revenue will likely drop as foreign manufacturers ramp up production. These foreign industrial gas manufacturers can operate at a lower cost and pass these savings on to buyers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE US GOVERNMENT IS MORE CONCERNED WITH HARMFUL GAS EMISSIONS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Federal officials have enacted regulations to reduce the number of greenhouse gases produced by many industries and products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DOWNSTREAM MARKETS WILL LIKELY BOOST INDUSTRY DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Recovering manufacturing and construction activity will facilitate greater demand for chemically manufactured products like adhesives and paints.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures various forms of organic and inorganic industrial gases, including compressed, liquid and solid (i.e., dry ice). Examples of industrial gases include oxygen, hydrogen, helium, nitrogen and carbon dioxide supplied to various customers, including industrial and medical users.
key_trends: Declining energy prices have intermittently helped support profit.
Energy costs influence the production of industrial gases, both regarding demand from downstream markets and input cost.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Users of industrial gases in this segment include packaged goods producers, materials manufacturers, nonresidential construction equipment makers, and industrial equipment manufacturers.
Energy production and chemical manufacturers purchase various industrial gases like hydrogen and nitrogen.

Healthcare uses various industrial gases for different applications, including nitrous oxide as a base anesthetic, nitrogen in tissue freezing and storage, and carbon dioxide as a breathing stimulant.
Metal manufacturers purchase various industrial gases, including oxygen, acetylene, nitrogen, hydrogen, and argon.

products_and_services.product_description: Other gases include specialty refrigerant and propellant gases, like chloro- or hydro-fluorocarbons, welding gases like acetylene, and advanced technical gases, including phosphine or radon.

tier_1_suppliers: Metal Tank Manufacturing in the US
Oil & Gas Pipeline Construction in the US
Oil Drilling & Gas Extraction in the US
tier_1_buyers: Steel Rolling & Drawing in the US
Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Natural Gas Distribution in the US
Coal & Natural Gas Power in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Sales of nitrogen, oxygen and other air-separated gases are increasing
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Oxygen and nitrogen are the most common air-separated gases used in numerous industrial and manufacturing applications.

international_trade_points.trade_description: A few global manufacturers import products. Most gases must be stored and distributed under extreme pressure.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region includes Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Ohio and Wisconsin.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The CAA is a comprehensive Federal law regulating all air emissions sources.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Revenue volatility level is high in the oxygen and hydrogen gas manufacturing industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Due to product homogeneity, price, distribution and service base competition dominate.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Intensive capital costs and existing manufacturers' relationships with key markets discourage new entrants.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Manufacturers are susceptible to changes in the cost of input materials
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers have made significant investments to make their equipment more energy-efficient.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Demand for industrial gases is impacted by levels of production in the manufacturing, energy, construction, and industrial sectors.
